Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
CAN: The student may be able to draw a simple plant, but it may lack detail or context.
The student might attempt to include elements like a sun or water, but these may be randomly placed or unlabeled.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to show the plant growing well with access to sunlight and water (student may not illustrate cause-effect relationship).
The student may not depict wilting or unhealthy plants correctly or at all (student doesnâ€™t understand needs of plants).
The drawing is unlikely to show patterns like differences between healthy and unhealthy plants (student may not grasp pattern visualization).
